pr_title: [M] 1866525: Updated SCA certificate content prefixes and paths (ENT-2717)

timeline.message:
1866525: Updated SCA certificate content prefixes and paths

- Certificates generated for Simple Content Access (SCA) will
  use a placeholder value for the ENTITLEMENT_DATA certificate
  extension when generated from a Candlepin instance not running
  in standalone mode
- Content prefixes are no longer generated while Candlepin is not
  running in standalone mode

timeline.bodyText: Just curious why having a dummy value prevents existing clients from breaking?
timeline.author: nikosmoum

replies.bodyText: The big one is subman/rhsmlib's certificate2.py doesn't check that the extension properly exists before attempting to use the value, so the result you get is an exception rather than a false from check_paths, or empty array of paths in provided_paths.
replies.author: Ceiu
